head.p: from: janesmith@gmail.com to: smitherwin@gmail.com RE: Racism in the USA Dec. 8th, 2021

p.s: I hope your school project went well.
After we read The Hate U Give in our English class, which I already told you about, I've actually become really interested in whether racism is a topical problem in the USA.
I stumbled across this article from a famous and established German online newspaper magazine, which I want to tell you about.
It says that theythere are statistics that show how black men are significantly more likely to get arrested than white men.
It's also common for black people to not be able to graduate high school, or generally don't have degrees as high as white people on the average.
But even in the cases, where they do have a degree the possibility of them being unemployed is higher than for white people.
Reading all these factors I'm not surprised that the number of poor black residents is more than double as much the number of poor white residents.
I'm honestly shocked about the extent of inequality in all these different aspects.
I'm curious if your experience matches what is said in the article, Erwin.
And I hope this was somewhat eduactional to you as well.
I hope to hear from you soon.
